pullrequest.title: issue #194, increase upper limit of joint damping coefficient settings.  pass through kp_velocity to implicit joint damping.

content.raw:
## Limits on CFM damping magnitude: ##

The CFM damping mechanism is not subject to joint effort limits, due to the way it is computed. To ensure that joint limits are still satisfied, the damping coefficients are limited. The limits were determined based on the limits on effort and velocity at each joint.

## Limits on number of changes: ##

The reasoning behind limiting the number of changes to the damping is that this mechanism is meant to approximate the inherent damping in the robot, rather than a tunable control mode. In order to accommodate the requests from different teams about the robot damping parameters, we have made it adjustable, but not a high-bandwidth control mode.
content.html:
Limits on CFM damping magnitude:

The CFM damping mechanism is not subject to joint effort limits, due to the way it is computed. To ensure that joint limits are still satisfied, the damping coefficients are limited. The limits were determined based on the limits on effort and velocity at each joint.

Limits on number of changes:

The reasoning behind limiting the number of changes to the damping is that this mechanism is meant to approximate the inherent damping in the robot, rather than a tunable control mode. In order to accommodate the requests from different teams about the robot damping parameters, we have made it adjustable, but not a high-bandwidth control mode.
